chargeHist.descr: Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Order - Temporary Restraining Order

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Order - Temporary Restraining Order

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Mohamad Yunus-Bin Mohamad

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Mohamad Yunus-Bin Mohamad not in court.  Attorney Michael J Cerniglia in court for Mohamad Yunus-Bin Mohamad.  Prosecuting attorney Katie Bakunowicz appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
Scheduling conference held. Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued REMAND TO JUDGE. Court takes no action as to bail.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.

Defendant Mohamad Yunus-Bin Mohamad not in court, in custody.  Attorney Michael J Cerniglia in court for Mohamad Yunus-Bin Mohamad.  Prosecuting attorney Katie Bakunowicz appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
Scheduling conference held. For reasons stated on the record, defense counsel requests an additional scheduling conference. Case is adjourned to Br. 29.
Adjourned order to show cause hearing scheduled for October 3, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Email correspondence with parties. Court is in trial on another matter. Case re-scheduled for a Scheduling Conference on 09/08/2022 at 01:30 PM, Br 29.
parties are advised that the due to the defendants lower pending matter (22CF2404) this case is re-assigned to Br. 29 Judge Kiefer.

Defendant Mohamad Yunus-Bin Mohamad in court with Attorney Michael J Cerniglia.  Defendant Mohamad Yunus-Bin Mohamad in custody.  Gregg Herman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Sworn as interpreter: Khinma Uddin. PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kiefer, Branch 29.  
Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned to Branch 29.  Scheduling conference scheduled for August 9, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
JusticePoint Services Violation Report (new criminal charges), filed.
JusticePoint Services Violation Report (new criminal charges), filed.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
Sworn as Rohingya interpreter: Uddid, Khinma

Defendant Mohamad Yunus-Bin Mohamad in court with attorney Melissa Jane Fitzsimmons.  Defendant Mohamad Yunus-Bin Mohamad in custody.  Katrina Amy Voge appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Mohamad Yunus-Bin Mohamad appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Rosa, Branch 35.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL. Defense motioned to dismiss count 2 due to language barrier. Court denied motion. Defense enters a plea of NOT GUILTY as to misdemeanor count(s) 2.
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 11, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered no contact with SNR (DOB 5/5/1978); 
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
